articles.title: Centre likely to prioritise debt consolidation, capex push in Budget 2026: ICRA
articles.summary: The upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27 is expected to prioritize medium-term debt consolidation while maintaining a strong push for capital expenditure. ICRA projects a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP, with a significant increase in capital spending to Rs 13.1 trillion, aiming to front-load infrastructure development before future fiscal rigidities.

articles.title: United Spirits Q3 Results: Cons PAT jumps 25% YoY to Rs 418 crore; net sales up 8%. Rs 6 per share dividend announced
articles.summary: United Spirits reported a 25% year-on-year increase in its December quarter consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 418 crore. Revenue from operations saw a nearly 3% rise to Rs 7,942 crore. The company also announced an interim dividend of Rs 6 per equity share.

articles.title: US bank stocks fall as investors await credit card rate cap deadline
articles.summary: U.S. bank stocks fell in ‍morning trading on Tuesday in a broader market decline ​as investors waited to see if the Trump administration's January 20 deadline to implement a 10% cap ⁠on credit card interest rates would take effect.

articles.title: Moderna shares up 2% as skin cancer vaccine shows sustained benefit in five-year follow-up
articles.summary: Moderna and Merck said on Tuesday their ⁠experimental personalized vaccine continued to cut the risk of death or recurrence of the most deadly skin cancer five years after the treatment started.

articles.title: EAAA India Alternatives files Rs 1,500-cr IPO papers with Sebi
articles.summary: EAAA India Alternatives, an arm of Edelweiss Financial Services, has filed preliminary papers with markets regulator Sebi to raise Rs 1,500 crore through an initial public offering (IPO).

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
articles.summary: Indian markets stayed cautious amid uncertainty over US tariff rulings, persistent FII outflows, rising global bond yields and a weaker rupee. Nifty technicals stayed bearish near 200-DMA, with mid and small caps underperforming ahead of earnings and global cues developments.

articles.title: Netflix shares inch up on all cash deal for Warner Bros
articles.summary: Netflix has switched to an all-cash offer for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming ​assets without increasing the $82.7 billion price in a bid to shut the door on Paramount's rival efforts to snag the Hollywood giant.

articles.title: US IT hardware stocks tumble as Morgan Stanley flags slowing demand
articles.summary: U.S. IT hardware ‍stocks dropped on Tuesday ​after Morgan Stanley downgraded the sector, warning of slowing ⁠demand as companies rein in spending amid economic uncertainty and rising component costs.

articles.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Hindustan Zinc & a midcap stock for up to 8% gains. Sell recommendation on Fortis Healthcare
articles.summary: Benchmark Nifty fell sharply for a second day amid tariff and geopolitical worries. Technicals stay bearish near oversold levels as the index drifts toward 200-DMA, while analysts flag fragile support and selective stock opportunities ahead now.

articles.title: Tata Motors (CV) block deal: BNP Paribas picks up Rs 152 crore stake as Goldman Sachs sells
articles.summary: BNP Paribas acquired 35.43 lakh Tata Motors Commercial Vehicle shares via a Rs 152 crore block deal from Goldman Sachs. Shares slipped post-deal, while the company reported a quarterly loss despite revenue growth and margin improvement.

articles.title: CreditAccess Grameen turns profitable as provisions fall in Q3
articles.summary: CreditAccess Grameen swung to a Rs 252 crore Q3 profit from a year-ago loss, aided by sharply lower provisions. Operating profit rose, assets grew, and management cited stabilising asset quality despite a higher gross NPA ratio across geographies this quarter.

articles.title: Shoppers Stop Q3 Results: Profit falls 69% to Rs 16 crore, revenue rises marginally
articles.summary: Retail chain Shoppers Stop on Tuesday reported a decline of 69.13 per cent in its consolidated net profit at Rs 16.12 crore in the December quarter of FY26, citing factors such as a shift in the festival period and uneven consumption trends.

articles.title: IndiaMart Q3 Results: Cons PAT jumps 56% YoY to Rs 188 crore, revenue up 13%
articles.summary: IndiaMART InterMesh posted strong December quarter results with profit up 56% year on year to Rs 188 crore, revenue rising 13%, robust collections growth, healthy deferred revenue, stable margins, and improving cash flows despite modest sequential topline growth trends overall.

articles.title: Adani Power plans up to Rs 7,500 crore NCD raise
articles.summary: Adani Power plans to raise Rs 7,500 crore via non-convertible debentures, targeting institutional investors to refinance debt and fund operations. The company operates 18 gigawatts of thermal capacity and aims to expand to 42 gigawatts by 2032.

articles.title: Persistent Systems Q3 Results: PAT grows 18% YoY to Rs 439 crore; company declares Rs 22 dividend
articles.summary: Persistent Systems posted steady Q3FY26 growth, with revenue up 17% YoY and PAT rising 18%. Sequential profitability moderated due to labour code impact, while demand for data, cloud, and digital engineering services remained robust.

articles.title: AU SFB Q3 Results: PAT jumps 26% YoY to Rs 668 crore, NII rises 16%
articles.summary: AU Small Finance Bank reported strong Q3FY26 performance, with profit rising 26% and NII up 16%, supported by higher margins, loan and deposit growth, stable asset quality and improving unsecured portfolio trends, despite higher operating expenses and exceptional provisioning.

articles.title: ET Market Watch: What drove today’s sharp market selloff
Nomura sued by Adani-linked fund accused in short-seller Hindenburg report
articles.summary: The Elara-owned Oyster Bay Fund borrowed from Nomura to make leveraged bets on Adani Enterprises and Adani Ports. Those positions collapsed after Hindenburg Research’s January 2023 report accused the Adani Group of “brazen stock manipulation” and suggested Elara-linked funds were involved, according to High Court filings.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: Hindustan Zinc, Ola Electric among 6 stocks that moved most on Tuesday
Defence budget may grow 8–10% annually; execution key for defence stocks: Amit Anwani, PL Capital
articles.summary: India’s defence spending may not rise sharply as a share of GDP, but capital outlays are set to grow 8–10% annually, says Amit Anwani of PL Capital. Aero engines, missiles and defence electronics could benefit, while execution and order delivery will matter more than fresh allocations. Submarine orders may boost shipbuilders.

articles.title: Promoters raise stakes in 10 Nifty 500 stocks in December quarter
Embassy Group to invest Rs 7K cr in Mumbai housing mkt to expand biz
articles.summary: Realty firm Embassy Developments on Tuesday said it will invest Rs 7,000 crore in the Mumbai market to build three new luxury housing projects and complete three ongoing projects as part of its strategy to expand its business amid strong consumer demand.

articles.title: Lodha Developers to invest Rs 1.3 lakh cr for 2.5 GW data centre park near Mumbai
articles.summary: Realty firm Lodha Developers Ltd will invest Rs 1.3 lakh crore to build a 2.5 gigawatt data centre park near Mumbai as part of its strategy to expand business.

articles.title: Rupee down for fifth day on dollar demand; likely RBI offers keeps record low at bay
articles.summary: The Indian rupee extended losses to a ‍fifth consecutive session on ​Tuesday as strong dollar demand continued to put pressure ⁠on the currency, while a fresh low was averted after likely central bank intervention.

articles.title: Budget Expectations: Axis picks 26 stocks from 8 sectors to watch out for
articles.summary: Axis Direct expects the FY27 Union Budget to balance growth and fiscal discipline, with a projected deficit of 4.2–4.4% of GDP, and has identified 26 stocks across eight sectors that could benefit from capex-led growth.

articles.title: Explained! Gold smashes Rs 1.5 lakh mark for first time, ever: 6 reasons why it appears unstoppable
articles.summary: Gold surged past the Rs 1.5 lakh mark for the first time as geopolitical tensions, tariff threats, strong investor demand, central bank buying, de-dollarisation trends, and rupee weakness combined to drive prices sharply higher in 2026.

articles.title: ITC Hotels Q3 Results: PAT jumps 77% YoY to Rs 235 crore, revenue rises 47%
articles.summary: ITC Hotels posted strong Q3FY26 results, with net profit surging 77% year-on-year to Rs 235 crore and revenue rising 47%, driven by robust hotel demand, sequential growth, and the first real estate revenue contribution, despite higher costs and stock reaction.

articles.title: Tata Capital passes on lower borrowing costs to customers; targets sub-1% credit cost, 25% AUM growth by FY28
articles.summary: Tata Capital is focusing on growth and customer affordability. The company is passing on lower funding costs to customers. Credit costs are declining and expected to go below 1% ahead of schedule. A 23-25% annual growth outlook remains intact. Operating efficiency and GenAI will drive profitability. Return on assets is projected to improve.

articles.title: The Golden Thumb Rule: Why great stocks fail at the wrong price | Srinivas Rao Ravuri
OpenAI concludes AI Jam sessions to drive AI adoption in social sector
articles.summary: OpenAI on Tuesday said it has concluded its India edition of the 'Nonprofit AI Jam', a multi-city series bringing together leaders and professionals for a hands-on working session on using artificial intelligence (AI) to drive effective, scalable outcomes.

articles.title: Portuguese tech companies meet Karnataka startups to explore AI, robotics partnerships
articles.summary: The interaction took place at the Global Innovation Alliance (GIA) - Portugal Edition, on Tuesday.

articles.title: AI startup Humans& raises $480 million at $4.5 billion valuation in seed round
articles.summary: AI startup Humans has secured a massive $480 million in seed funding. This significant investment values the company at $4.48 billion. The funding round was led by SV Angel and saw participation from Nvidia, Jeff Bezos, and Alphabet's GV. Humans aims to develop advanced AI systems that can plan, learn, and collaborate over extended periods.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Philips keen to partner with Telangana on AI, to explore setting up knowledge hub
articles.summary: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy-led 'Telangana Rising' delegation on Tuesday met the global leadership of renowned health tech company Royal Philips at the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos, Switzerland.

articles.title: AM Group to build $25 billion GW scale AI compute hub in Uttar Pradesh
articles.summary: The project, announced at the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos, involves a total investment of approximately $25 billion. This hub is designed to handle global AI workloads and will be one of the largest investments in India's digital infrastructure to date.

articles.title: Bristol Myers partners with Microsoft for AI-driven lung cancer detection
articles.summary: Bristol Myers Squibb is joining forces with Microsoft. They will use artificial intelligence to find lung cancer earlier. This technology analyses X-ray and CT scans. The goal is to help doctors spot difficult nodules. It also aims to identify patients at earlier disease stages.

articles.title: WEF 2026: Madhya Pradesh delegation discusses AI for agriculture, green data centres with Google
articles.summary: In a significant move to bolster its digital infrastructure and innovation ecosystem, the Government of Madhya Pradesh met Sanjay Gupta, President of Asia Pacific at Google, at the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2026 on Tuesday.

articles.title: Legal AI startup Ivo raises $55 million in latest funding round
articles.summary: IVO-Legal AI startup Ivo raises $55 million in latest funding round

articles.title: BCCI bags Rs 270 crore AI sponsorship deal for IPL
articles.summary: The BCCI has inked a significant Rs 270 crore sponsorship deal with Google's AI platform Gemini. This partnership will span three years, beginning with the 2026 Indian Premier League. The agreement highlights the growing interest of artificial intelligence companies in Indian cricket. Gemini's rival, ChatGPT, is also a sponsor of the ongoing Women's Premier League.

articles.title: LTIMindtree to roll out wage hikes in Q4; 50% workforce to be covered in first phase
articles.summary: LTIMindtree will begin annual pay rises from Q4 FY26, covering half its staff initially and spreading increases over two quarters to protect margins. Chandra noted that the financial impact of the wage hike is expected to be approximately 1% in each of the two quarters. However, the company aims to offset this through operational efficiencies and its "New Horizon" enterprise-wide programme.

articles.title: Ursula von der Leyen speaks at World Economic Forum | Davos 2026 LIVE
AI startup Emergent raises $70 million from Khosla Ventures, SoftBank; valuation triples to $300 million
articles.summary: Emergent has raised $70 million in new funding, lifting its valuation to about $300 million just months after launch. The startup helps users build apps cheaply using AI and has grown revenues rapidly worldwide. The latest financing comes three months after Emergent raised $23 million led by Lightspeed.

articles.title: Living with AI | How I use ChatGPT to plan travel: Rohit Bansal
articles.summary: I begin by giving it context: myself and wife traveling along with two children aged 10 and 12, an interest in being outdoors, and a low tolerance for long stretches of inactivity, writes Rohit Bansal.

articles.title: AI is writing your travel diaries
articles.summary: AI travel influencers are here, can they coexist with human creators? ET finds out.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence

articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: UAE President accepts US invitation to Board of Peace
articles.summary: Decision reflects support for implementation of Trump’s Gaza peace plan.

articles.title: Muthoot Microfin approves ₹200 crore secured NCD issuance, cancels ₹150 crore second tranche
articles.summary: Muthoot Microfin approved the issuance of secured, rated, listed, redeemable NCDs aggregating up to ₹200 crore on a private placement basis, with multiple series offering tenures of 24 to 36 months and coupons ranging from 9.70% to 9.95% per annum, payable monthly, and proposed to be listed on BSE.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Markets shrug off geopolitics as AI, data centres and power grids fuel a new growth cycle: Blackstone CEO
articles.summary: Stephen Schwarzman says global investors are prioritising artificial intelligence-led growth and infrastructure spending over unresolved geopolitical risks, as massive investments in data centres and power grids reshape economic momentum in the US and beyond.

articles.summary: With financing conditions still favourable and boardroom confidence improving, global companies are stepping up dealmaking activity, even as investors weigh the opportunities and risks from artificial intelligence, inflation and geopolitics while shaping their strategies for 2026.

articles.title: Supreme Petrochem Q3 profit slumps 80% as revenue, EBITDA tumble
articles.summary: Supreme Petrochem Q3 net profit plunged 80% to ₹30.6 crore, revenue fell 66%, and shares dropped 3.48% amid business slowdown and new labour code liabilities. Shares of Supreme Petrochem ended lower on Tuesday, January 20, by 3.48% at 514.00 on the NSE.

articles.title: Davos 2026: What top industry voices and experts said about India, growth and opportunity
articles.summary: From big bets on India to brand growth and long-term market faith, global business leaders at the World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos shared sharp insights on strategy, scale, and opportunity. Here are the top quotes from Davos that highlight why India continues to stay at the centre of global boardroom conversations.

articles.title: Pace Digitek subsidiary secures 2nd ₹94 crore order from BSNL for Li-Ion battery solutions
articles.summary: Pace Digitek’s subsidiary Lineage Power has secured a ₹94.35 crore BSNL order for 25,000 Li-Ion modules and 2,500 IP55 racks, including supply, installation, five-year warranty, and optional five-year AMC.

articles.title: Lavrov says Russia has questions on ‘Board of Peace’, dismisses Greenland seizure claims

articles.title: Davos 2026 | After AkzoNobel deal, JSW Paints eyes top-three slot; ₹7,000-crore platform by FY26
articles.summary: With the Dulux brand now under its fold, JSW Group is preparing a major push in India’s paints market by integrating operations, expanding dealer reach and redeploying royalty savings into advertising and distribution. The company expects the JSW Paints–AkzoNobel combine to scale rapidly, improve margins and emerge as a serious challenger to the market leaders over the next few years.

articles.title: Rallis India Q3 Results | Net profit falls 5-fold on wage code provision, other parameters rise
articles.summary: Rallis India’s Q3 net profit fell 81.8% to ₹2 crore due to an exceptional gratuity provision under the wage code, despite a 19.3% rise in revenue to ₹623 crore and a 31.8% increase in EBITDA to ₹58 crore. Strong volume growth across crop care, seeds, and B2B segments supported performance, alongside new product launches and innovation milestones, including Fateh Nxt™ and patents for herbicide combinations.

articles.title: PowerGrid to procure reactors, transformers worth ₹914 crore
articles.summary: Three proposals approved for implementation within 30 months. PowerGrid shares were trading at ₹254.50 on Tuesday, down ₹3.15, or 1.22%.

articles.title: AI will transform the global economy, but job growth remains a key risk: Eswar Prasad at Davos
articles.summary: Eswar Prasad, Professor of Economics at Cornell University and former head of the IMF’s China division, said breaking out of the doom loop will be difficult as the challenges are structural. He noted that progress will require engaged citizens focused on shared prosperity, strong leadership that looks beyond short-term interests, and the rebuilding of credible national and international institutions.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Scott Bessent sings Trump tune on Greenland, advises ‘deep breath’ for the world
articles.summary: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent (often seen as 'the adult in the room') says Greenland is vital to Donald Trump’s national security strategy and the 'golden dome' missile shield, warning its strategic value could spark conflict if foreign powers seek control.

articles.title: Stocks to Watch for Jan 21: Persistent Systems, United Spirits, DCM Shriram and more
articles.summary: Persistent marks 23 quarters of growth but profit dips; United Spirits beats estimates; DCM Shriram profit falls; Shoppers Stop profit plunges; JSW inks deal. Here are few stocks to track ahead of Wednesday's trading session.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | IKEA 'emotionally biased' towards India, sees long-term growth: Ingka CEO
articles.summary: Ingka Group CEO said IKEA is 'emotionally biased' towards India, where it is expanding online operations, strengthening supplier partnerships and positioning the country as a global model for sustainable and affordable growth.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Apollo Tyres eyes double-digit growth in India, to shut Netherlands plant amid Chinese imports
articles.summary: From Davos 2026, Apollo Tyres’ Vice-Chairman Neeraj Kanwar said GST cuts are boosting demand in India, with double-digit growth expected. He said Europe remains weak amid Chinese tyre imports and a Netherlands plant shutdown.

articles.title: JSW Energy arm signs PPA for 1,600 MW thermal project in West Bengal
articles.summary: Greenfield plant to be set up at Salboni, West Bengal, with commissioning planned within six years; this follows a similar PPA in March, 2025.

articles.title: India amends motor vehicle rules: No NOC, fitness renewal or permits if toll dues pending
articles.summary: The Government of India has amended the Motor Vehicles Rules to block NOCs, fitness renewals and national permits for vehicles with unpaid tolls logged in the Electronic Toll Collection system.

articles.title: United Spirits Q3 profit beats estimates despite margin miss; board declares dividend
articles.summary: United Spirits reported a stronger-than-expected Q3 FY26 profit, aided by premium portfolio growth, even as margins fell short of estimates and policy headwinds weighed on select state markets.

articles.title: Trade Setup for January 21 | Nifty at a crossroads: Will the 200-DMA hold?
articles.summary: The sell-off triggered a sharp erosion of investor wealth, with the market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies shrinking by over ₹20 lakh crore so far in 2026.

articles.title: DCM Shriram Q3 | New labour code cuts into profit; revenue rises; declares dividend
articles.summary: DCM Shriram Q3FY26 net profit fell 19% to ₹212 crore despite 13.8% revenue growth. Shares of DCM Shriram ended lower on Tuesday, January 20, by 1.96% at ₹1,110 on the NSE.

articles.title: Auroras light up the world as strongest solar radiation storm hits Earth
articles.summary: The National Weather Service's Space Weather Prediction Center has issued a warning for a level four out of five solar radiation storm.

articles.title: Delhi air quality: GRAP Stage‑IV revoked as AQI improves; Stage I–III curbs to stay
articles.summary: CAQM lifts GRAP Stage-IV curbs in Delhi after AQI improves to 378, but Stage-I, II and III restrictions remain. Agencies to intensify monitoring as winter may worsen air quality.

articles.title: CCI approves Emirates NBD-RBL Bank deal; Tata Steel's Thriveni Pellets buy also cleared
articles.summary: CCI approves Emirates NBD's acquisition of up to 74% in RBL Bank and Tata Steel's purchase of 50.01% in Thriveni Pellets, clearing key regulatory hurdles for both deals.

articles.title: Emergent raises $70 million; total funding now at $100 million
articles.summary: The company said the funds will be used to support team expansion, accelerate product development and expand into new markets as demand for AI-driven software creation grows among entrepreneurs and small businesses.

articles.title: Republic Day Long Weekend: Last-minute getaways from Delhi, Mumbai, and other major cities
articles.summary: The Republic Day long weekend is a good chance to take a short break without using many leave days. For those who have not planned ahead, there are still several destinations close to major cities that are easy to reach and do not need detailed planning. Here are some last-minute travel ideas from major Indian cities that can be covered comfortably in two or three days.

articles.summary: CreditAccess Grameen posted a net profit of ₹252 crore in Q3 after last year's loss of ₹100 crore, with NII up 13% and improved collection efficiency. Branches and borrowers also increased significantly.

articles.title: Shoppers Stop Q3 Results | Profit plunges 22-fold; festive weakness, pollution leave sales flat
articles.summary: Shoppers Stop’s Q3 net profit fell sharply to ₹16.1 crore from ₹352.2 crore a year ago, while revenue grew 2.6% to ₹1,415 crore. EBITDA declined 11.1% to ₹217.8 crore, with margins dropping to 15.4% from 17.7%. Overall sales were flat due to festive calendar shifts, weak discretionary demand, and elevated pollution in North India.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Tariffs, risky geopolitics have not stopped CEOs from investing: PwC
articles.summary: PwC’s latest CEO survey shows that global business leaders are staying invested despite rising tariff risks and geopolitical uncertainty. Speaking to CNBC-TV18 from Davos 2026, PwC Global Chairman Mohamed Kande and PwC India Chairperson Sanjeev Krishan explain why capital continues to flow despite the risks.

articles.summary: “In India, we have been basically doubling our size in sales every five years… and we keep investing, not only on capex with new plants, but also on acquisitions,” Bazin told CNBC-TV18

articles.summary: Gone are the days when listed new-age tech companies were few and far between. Startup IPOs are almost commonplace in

articles.title: India asks dependents of Bangladesh Mission & Post officials to return home, cites security situation: Report
Punjab Police launch 'Operation Prahar'; raid locations linked to 60 foreign-based gangsters
Manikarnika Ghat row: Politics over demolition and clearing drive in Varanasi — what's the controversy
articles.summary: A political storm brews over Varanasi's Manikarnika Ghat, with opposition parties accusing the BJP government of damaging ancient heritage during a beautification drive. Claims of destroyed idols and temples have surfaced, while authorities deny wrongdoing, stating the work protects heritage and corrects neglect. FIRs have been filed against those allegedly spreading misinformation.

articles.title: Delhi government to construct six lane elevated road in South Delhi at a cost of over Rs 1400 cr
articles.summary: The Delhi government's Finance Committee has approved the construction of a new six-lane elevated road in South Delhi, at an estimated cost of over ₹1,400 crore.

articles.title: Nitin Nabin takes charge as BJP president: What's at stake for PM Modi's 'boss' in party
National interest isn’t anyone’s monopoly, it’s a shared duty: Mohan Bhagwat
CM Naidu 'misused' Davos visit for political gains: YSRCP leader
Sold-out hotels, packed flights: How India is becoming a global concert destination
Delhi air pollution: GRAP IV restrictions revoked; decision after slight improvement
articles.summary: Delhi-NCR's air quality has seen improvement, leading the Commission for Air Quality Management to revoke GRAP-IV restrictions just three days after their re-imposition. While the 'severe+' category triggered the ban, stages I, II, and III of GRAP remain active. This move offers some relief from the stringent pollution control measures.

articles.title: SIR 'harassment': West Bengal districts erupt in protest; forces deployed
articles.summary: Protests erupted in West Bengal districts over alleged harassment during electoral roll revision, with roads blocked and tyres set ablaze. The Supreme Court stressed transparency in the process, while demonstrators claim genuine voters are being unfairly targeted with "logical discrepancies" notices. Authorities have increased force deployment in affected areas.

articles.title: 'Decision at right time': DK Shivakumar's brother namedrops Rahul Gandhi in CM row; Siddaramaiah puts it to 'high command’
articles.summary: Speculation over the Karnataka chief minister post continues. DK Shivakumar's brother said that Rahul Gandhi assured a decision would be made at an "appropriate time". Shivakumar is reportedly exercising restraint for party unity. The upcoming legislative session may offer clarity. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah remains open to discussions in New Delhi.

articles.title: 'Where is the election?' Congress' swipe after Nitin Nabin takes over as BJP chief; RJD joins criticism
Tejashwi Yadav vs Misa Bharti? RJD national executive meeting on Jan 25; to decide 'working president'
'Committed contempt': SC criticises Maneka Gandhi on remarks on stray dogs order; and makes a 'Kasab' reference
KONE sets up central region office in Hyderabad
Vande Bharat sleeper tickets sold within hours! Indian Railways’ new train on Kamakhya–Howrah route sees strong debut; all you want to know
Diesel locomotives being phased out? Indian Railways pushes for engines run on alternative fuels like hydrogen; check details
Rupee’s decline continues: Currency closes at record low of 90.97 against US dollar; depreciates by 7 paise
ImagiNxt 2026 to bring startups, investors and policymakers together
PhonePe IPO gets SEBI nod; company eyes April listing
Hyderabad's AM Group to set up 1GW AI compute hub in Gr Noida at $25 billion investment
China criticises US tariffs at World Economic Forum; promises wider opening of economy
articles.summary: China used its platform at the World Economic Forum in Davos to warn that trade and tariff wars help no one and risk deepening global economic tensions. Vice-Premier He Lifeng called for cooperation over isolation, saying China would open its economy further and focus on boosting domestic demand, even as global trade disputes escalate under US President Donald Trump’s expanded tariff policies.

articles.title: ITC hotels records record revenue & profit in Q3 FY26
SEBI Clears PhonePe IPO: Regulator approves high-profile listing; process to begin soon
'Hunger Games-style fight for jobs': Massive layoff of government workers in Canada; only these officers won't be fired
'We are in Australia, get back to your own country': Indian-origin father claims racial attack in Sydney; no action taken because...
Justin Trudeau appears in Davos with Katy Perry; speaks on Trump, Canada, Greenland
“Virtually banned everywhere”: Sneako reportedly banned from US hospitality groups after anti-Semitism allegations surface
articles.summary: Sneako is facing fresh backlash after a promoter claimed on livestream that the streamer has been banned from nearly all US hospitality groups due to racist and anti-Semitic remarks. The confrontation went viral as the promoter cut personal ties with Sneako. The claims surfaced shortly after an IRL stream in Miami sparked outrage and venue condemnation.

articles.title: “Willing to blame the wives”: Internet erupts after Perez Hilton reacts to Brooklyn Beckham’s explosive claims
articles.summary: Perez Hilton reacted strongly after Brooklyn Beckham publicly addressed his estrangement from David and Victoria Beckham on Instagram. Brooklyn blamed long-standing family control, alleged interference in his wedding to Nicola Peltz, and media narratives for the rift. Hilton said Brooklyn “exposed his family,” comparing the situation to Prince Harry’s experience and sparking widespread online debate.

articles.title: India among most important markets for us, will continue to invest there: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the company's President and Chief Product Officer said India accounts for the largest concentration of its people outside the US.

articles.title: AI most profound platform shift in human history; every job, workflow will be reconfigured: Cisco
articles.summary: Speaking to PTI here during the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, the technology giant's President and Chief Product Officer, Jeetu Patel, said every job will get reconfigured, and every workflow is going to change due to AI.

articles.title: Space next big place for data centres: Cisco
articles.summary: Patel, President and Chief Product Officer at Cisco, said while green data centres are going to be very prominent soon, the next few years would witness those centres being built in the space to tackle infrastructure, mainly power, constraints.

articles.title: Lodha Developers to invest $11 billion in 2.5 GW data centre park in Maharashtra
articles.summary: ​India's Lodha ⁠Developers said on Tuesday ‌that it ‌would ‌invest an additional Rs 1 lakh crore ($11 billion) ​to ​build a ‌2.5 ‍gigawatt data ‍centre park in the ‌state of Maharashtra, expanding on an ‍earlier commitment of Rs 30,000 ‍crore.

articles.title: Japan, US narrow first $550 billion investment picks, including SoftBank-linked plan, sources say
articles.summary: The two governments have intensified discussions to select the initial projects ‌under the ‌investment scheme, agreed as part of Tokyo's deal with Washington to lower tariffs on Japanese exports ‌to the United States, the sources said on Monday.

articles.title: Malaysia's Khazanah to steer more capital to power grids, chip firms, chief says in Davos
articles.summary: Surging AI computing needs were reshaping what is "investable" in the AI boom, with energy supply and grid resilience being central to ‌competitiveness, Khazanah ‌Managing Director Amirul Feisal Wan Zahir said in an interview at the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos.

articles.title: Taylor Swift label UMG inks licensing deal with China's NetEase Cloud Music
articles.summary: The ‌multi-year license ‌agreement allows UMG-signed artists like Taylor ‌Swift to stream on NetEase's platform. The deal includes provisions and terms covering artificial intelligence both companies ​said reflect a "shared ​commitment to responsible AI practices ‌that ‍support and protect the ‍music and artists that UMG represents," ‌in a statement announcing the deal.

articles.title: Ecommerce platforms may post 20-22% growth in Republic Day sales
articles.summary: Ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon India and Flipkart are set to post 20–22% growth during their ongoing Republic Day sales compared with last year, extending the online shopping momentum seen during the 2025 festive season, according to industry experts.

articles.title: India must speed up AI upskilling: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: India's central bank proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies
articles.summary: India will host the summit, which will be held later this year. If ‌the recommendation is accepted, ‌a proposal to link the digital currencies of BRICS members would be put forward for the first time. The RBI's proposal builds ​on a 2025 declaration at a BRICS summit in Rio de Janeiro, which pushed for interoperability between members' payment systems ​to make cross-border transactions more efficient.

articles.title: US Commerce Secretary warns some Korean, Taiwanese firms may face 100% chip tariffs unless they invest in US
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick warned South Korean and Taiwanese chipmakers of 100% tariffs unless they expand manufacturing in America. The Trump administration is using trade deals and tariff threats to push investment, while temporarily pausing broad semiconductor levies. Micron’s vast US expansion underlines the approach as Samsung and SK Hynix weigh responses.

articles.title: FICCI's Manufacturing Index reaches all-time high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector shows sustained growth and optimism, with 91% reporting higher or same production levels in Q3 FY 2025-26. Domestic demand is also strong, with 86% anticipating increased orders. Despite capacity utilization near 75%, global and operational challenges are noted, though export expectations remain positive.

articles.title: India's billion-dollar trade deal may be the real show this Republic Day
articles.summary: India and the European Union are set to announce the conclusion of negotiations for a long-pending free trade agreement at a summit in New Delhi on January 27, coinciding with India’s 77th Republic Day celebrations. The deal, described by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal as the “mother of all trade deals,” caps nearly two decades of stop-start talks and is expected to be signed in the coming months after legal clearances.

articles.title: Budget 2026 and why stability, not scale, matters in today’s fractured global order
articles.summary: India's democratic institutions offer a rare competitive edge in a volatile global economy. As geopolitical risks reshape trade, regulatory certainty and predictable processes are paramount for attracting investment. Reforms in customs, export controls, and stakeholder consultation are crucial for building a trustworthy, rules-based economic ecosystem, shielding currency risks from becoming investment hesitations.

articles.title: Trump effect: Cotton fabrics exports drop 30%
articles.summary: Indian cotton textile exports saw a sharp fall after the US introduced tariffs in August 2025. Shipments dropped by nearly 30 percent following the levy. This decline impacted all categories, including fabrics, made-ups, and ready-made garments. Companies are exploring strategies like discounts to mitigate the impact. The situation is expected to remain volatile for some time.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal meets US Ambassador Sergio Gor, Senator Steve Daines; discusses bilateral issues
articles.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Ambassador Sergio Gor and Senator Steve Daines to discuss bilateral issues, including ongoing trade agreement negotiations. The discussions come amidst a 50% US import duty on Indian goods and US senators' calls for favorable provisions for American pulse crop producers in any future trade deal.

articles.title: India’s FY26 GDP growth of 7.3% to boost average household income, insurance demand: Moody’s
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.3 per cent in FY 2025. This robust expansion will boost household incomes and drive demand for insurance. The insurance sector anticipates sustained premium growth due to economic strength, digitisation, and planned reforms. Increased risk awareness and easier product access are also contributing factors.

articles.title: RBI proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies, sources say
articles.summary: India's central bank has proposed linking BRICS nations' digital currencies to facilitate cross-border trade and tourism payments, potentially reducing reliance on the U.S. dollar. This initiative, to be discussed at the 2026 BRICS summit, builds on previous calls for payment system interoperability among member states.

articles.title: National Highway builders ask Finmin to clarify arbitration order
articles.summary: The National Highway Builders Federation has urged the finance ministry to clarify its order ending arbitration for highway projects. The federation warns this change discourages investment and increases project costs. It suggests the new dispute resolution framework could make projects unbankable. This impacts ongoing projects and future infrastructure development. The federation is also flagging concerns with bankers and financial lenders.

articles.title: CII's Biz Confidence Index climbs to five-quarter high in Q3 FY26
articles.summary: Business confidence in India is soaring, reaching a five-quarter high. Firms are optimistic about demand, profitability, and investment. GST rate cuts and festive spending are boosting sales. The industry expects the Reserve Bank of India to cut repo rates. CII suggests continued reforms and infrastructure investment for sustained growth.

articles.title: How Budget 2026 can help India strike the right balance in trade policy for a world in flux
articles.summary: India's trade strategy is at a critical juncture, shifting from broad liberalization to selective engagement. New trade pacts diversify markets, while domestic initiatives like PLI schemes build manufacturing strength. The upcoming Union Budget must focus on enhancing access, ensuring assurance in supply chains, and fostering agility to navigate global trade disruptions and secure India's competitive edge.

articles.title: Will dal derail deal? New irritant looms over India-US trade talks
articles.summary: India-US trade deal: US senators are urging Trump to push India to remove tariffs on American pulse exports. This demand touches upon India's agricultural policies and its goal of self-reliance in pulses. India's decision to impose tariffs was to protect its farmers. This could complicate the ongoing trade deal negotiations.

articles.title: IEX shares fall over 4% ahead of APTEL hearing on market coupling
articles.summary: IEX shares fell sharply on Tuesday ahead of APTEL’s hearing on the market coupling issue, extending their two-day decline. Investor caution has risen as CERC signalled that market coupling will not proceed until proper regulations are framed, while past orders face uncertainty.

articles.title: Dow futures sink over 600 points; Trump’s Greenland move drags Europe, Asian markets
articles.summary: Global markets tumbled Tuesday as U.S. futures indicated sharp declines following President Trump's threat of new tariffs on eight European countries. Asian shares mostly fell, with Tokyo's Nikkei down 1.1% amid election speculation and rising bond yields. European markets also opened lower, reflecting concerns over trade tensions and corporate earnings.

articles.title: Japan bond yields surge to records as election stokes fiscal concerns; stocks and yen fall
articles.summary: Japanese government bonds (JGBs) plunged, sending ⁠yields to record highs, while Tokyo stocks and the yen also fell after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's calling of a snap election shook confidence in the country's fiscal health.

articles.title: Eternal Q3 Preview: Earnings set to grow 50% YoY; Blinkit losses persist
articles.summary: Eternal anticipates strong growth in the December quarter. Blinkit's shift to a first-party model and quick commerce are key drivers. Food delivery shows steady demand and improving margins. Blinkit's rapid expansion continues, but losses persist. Hyperpure also sees growth. Analysts will watch competitive intensity and Blinkit's path to profitability.

articles.title: Arohan Financial Services plans to hit capital market during middle of 2026-27 with Rs 1,500 cr IPO
articles.summary: Arohan Financial Services plans to launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Rs 1,500 crore in the second quarter of the next financial year. The NBFC-MFI aims to raise Rs 750 crore through fresh shares and Rs 750 crore via an offer for sale by existing investors. The company is also looking to diversify into secured lending products.

articles.title: Shadowfax Technologies IPO Day 1 Update: Subscribed 15%, GMP indicates 6% listing gains. Should you invest?
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies’ IPO opened with 15% subscription on Day 1, driven by strong retail interest. Grey market premium suggests a 6% listing gain, though sentiment has cooled. Analysts advise a neutral stance amid premium valuations.

articles.title: Bitcoin slips to $91,000 as US–EU trade war escalation weighs on sentiment
articles.summary: Bitcoin slipped to the $91,000 level amid risk-off sentiment triggered by escalating US–EU trade tensions. Broader crypto markets remained subdued as liquidations flushed out leverage, while analysts noted continued consolidation within a wide range, with macro cues and policy signals likely to drive the next directional move.

articles.title: Everstone-owned Wingify to buy AB Tasty, create $500 million SaaS entity
articles.summary: Everstone-owned Wingify is acquiring Paris-based AB Tasty in a deal valuing the combined company at around $500 million. The merged firm, led by Wingify CEO Sparsh Gupta, will have over 800 employees across 11 global offices and focus on AI-driven digital experience optimisation. It will compete with Adobe, Optimizely, and Bloomreach.

articles.title: VC firm Avaana Capital appoints Vikas Verma as partner, promotes Shruti Srivastava
articles.summary: Founded in 2018, Avaana Capital has backed startups such as Aerem, Amperehour, Eeki Foods, Kazam, Turno and GreenGrahi, and has previously invested in companies such as Agnikul, Delhivery, Nykaa and Urban Company. The fund’s focus areas include deeptech entrepreneurs building in the fields of energy, mobility and supply chains, advanced manufacturing, AI and robotics.

articles.title: Inside China's buzzing AI scene year after DeepSeek shock
articles.summary: Before DeepSeek shook up the tech world and put Chinese artificial intelligence on the map, Wu Chenglin's own startup had nearly folded three times -- but in the past year it has raised $30 million. But as excitement around DeepSeek fuelled a boom in spending, Wu raised 220 million yuan in two funding rounds.

articles.title: Britain needs 'AI stress tests' for financial services, lawmakers say
articles.summary: In a report on AI in financial services, the Treasury Committee said the Financial Conduct Authority and the Bank of England should start running AI‑specific stress tests to help firms ‌prepare for ‌market shocks triggered by automated systems.

articles.title: Republic Day to lift ecommerce sales; Shadowfax nets anchor funds
articles.summary: Happy Tuesday! Ecommerce sales are set to rise during this year’s Republic Day sale season. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Rise in contract value for top IT firms signals stronger deal pipeline
articles.summary: India’s top IT firms showed mixed Q3 results, with Infosys, HCLTech and Tech Mahindra posting strong deal growth, signalling improving demand. TCS and Wipro saw declines, though management noted early signs of AI-led service recovery. Analysts caution that execution, pricing pressure, and evolving AI adoption may limit short-term growth despite healthy bookings.

articles.title: AI to reshape India’s $280-billion IT industry, but skill gaps could trigger job losses: Coursera cofounder Andrew Ng
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. He also cautioned against the swelling hype over AGI, arguing that large language models are not a path to human-level intelligence and that claims of AGI being imminent are misleading.

articles.title: Nandan Nilekani’s Fundamentum leads $15 million bet on materials science startup Whizzo
articles.summary: Whizzo has raised $15 million in a round led by Nandan Nilekani’s Fundamentum, with participation from South Korea-based deeptech player LB Investment, and existing backers Lightspeed Venture Partners and BEENEXT.

articles.title: Warehouse automation startup Unbox Robotics raises $28 million led by ICICI Venture
articles.summary: Unbox Robotics has raised $28 million in a round led by ICICI Venture, with participation from RedStart Labs, a subsidiary of InfoEdge, F-Prime, 3one4 Capital, Navam Capital, Force Ventures and existing investors, ET has learnt. The round, which includes a mix of primary and secondary capital, will be used to grow its engineering team, accelerate product development and expand market presence across India and other countries.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: CNBC-TV18 Newsbreak confirmed | RBA to see new promoter as Chinese Wok owner steps in; Everstone exits fully
articles.summary: CNBC-TV18 Newsbreak confirmed: Restaurant Brands Asia will see a new promoter as Chinese Wok owner Inspira Global steps in via a ₹70-per-share preferential issue, alongside Everstone’s exit and a mandatory open offer.

articles.title: Exclusive | ReNew revives US delisting plan; CEO Sumant Sinha flags challenges of staying listed
articles.summary: ReNew Energy Global may delist from NASDAQ as CPPIB and ADIA revive the take-private plan, aiming for an India listing; Masdar exited the consortium, impacting the earlier deal.

articles.title: Budget 2026 needs to be more than Aatmanirbhar
articles.summary: In a world where leverage beats values-based alliances, strategic autonomy is a necessity both for economic growth and diplomatic success. Therefore, the next budget must be anchored in foreign policy as much as local economic needs.

articles.title: What it would take for India to be a high-income country by 2047
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a goal for India to become a developed nation by 2047. Based on recent trends and estimates, here’s a snapshot of the growth rate required to achieve that goal.

articles.title: FMCG demand stabilises after GST reset, but recovery remains uneven
articles.summary: Industry data shows FMCG growth has sustained in recent months but is now driven mainly by volumes after the GST reset and lower prices. Value growth remains softer, while competition among online and offline retail channels is increasing.

articles.title: US Senators pitch for favourable pulse crop provision in potential India-US trade pact
articles.summary: In a letter dated January 16, 2026, US Senators Kevin Cramer and Steve Daines have encouraged the US President "to push for favourable pulse crop provisions in any agreement the United States" signs with India as trade negotiations progress.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet
articles.summary: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement talks are “very near” conclusion, but Commerce Ministry says no deadline can be set. Exports impacted by US tariffs are being managed through diversification and FTAs.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Revamping auto PLI can unlock EV growth, says Deloitte India
articles.summary: Deloitte India has said targeted changes to the automobile PLI scheme in the upcoming Budget could ease cost pressures on EV makers, widen participation and accelerate green mobility, citing challenges around localisation norms, investment thresholds and GST structure.

articles.title: India needs inflation again: Why nominal GDP, not real growth, is the real Budget 2026 challenge
articles.summary: As India heads into Budget 2026, economists are rethinking long-held assumptions about growth and stability. With inflation at multi-decade lows and nominal GDP losing momentum, policymakers face a new challenge: reviving revenues, earnings and debt dynamics in a world where disinflation may be structural rather than cyclical.

articles.title: Fix the tax collector, not the tax rate: Dhruva Advisors' Budget 2026 pitch
articles.summary: As the finance ministry readies Budget 2026, Dhruva Advisors has urged a decisive shift towards cleaner tax administration, calling for predictable interpretations, streamlined TDS rates, and a rethink of legacy mechanisms such as TCS. The firm argues that targeted tax incentives for AI, semiconductor manufacturing, and research are essential to improve investor confidence and lift India’s long-term innovation capacity.

articles.title: JioHotstar annual premium plan raised to ₹2,199, monthly packs introduced
articles.summary: JioHotstar raised its Premium annual price to ₹2,199 and added monthly plans from ₹79. Hollywood content is now in Super and Premium tiers. Existing users keep old rates if auto-renewed.

articles.title: PwC Global CEO Survey: Key takeaways on what Indian CEOs think about growth, risks, and AI
articles.summary: The PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey: India perspective shows that Indian CEOs are more optimistic about local growth, more active in expanding into new sectors, and more concerned about the speed of AI change. At the same time, many are already seeing financial benefits from using AI. Here are the main insights from the survey.

articles.title: India CEOs more confident than global peers, but increasingly wary of AI gaps and cyber risks: PwC survey
articles.summary: India CEOs show strong optimism for domestic growth and revenue, but face rising concerns over AI readiness, cybersecurity, and execution, according to PwC’s 29th Annual Global CEO Survey.

articles.title: Shadowfax sees 23-25% revenue growth as market share and value-added services expand
articles.summary: Shadowfax said its recent surge in growth was driven by higher consumption, wider digital adoption, and consolidation in the logistics sector. The company highlighted the growing contribution of value-added services such as same-day delivery and omnichannel logistics, which now form a large part of revenue and support profitability. It also said quick commerce is becoming a bigger part of its business, cash flows have turned positive, and client diversification risks have reduced as market condi

articles.title: UPL subsidiary Advanta Enterprises files IPO papers with SEBI
articles.summary: The issue will be entirely an Offer-for-Sale (OFS) of 3.61 crore equity shares, with no fresh issue component. UPL will offer 2.8 crore shares for sale in the issue.

articles.title: ITC Hotels Q3 Results: Strong revenue growth leads operating performance, margin expansion
articles.summary: ITC Hotels' revenue growth of 47% during the quarter contributed to its robust operating performance, which saw a nearly nine percentage points jump in its EBITDA margin.

articles.title: Senores Pharma Q3 results: Shares fall 6% despite strong operating performance, margin expansion
articles.summary: Senores Pharma reported a strong Q3 with net profit rising 88% to ₹32 crore and margins expanding to 31%. Shares, however, fell over 5% despite record emerging markets performance.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Mahindra & Mahindra plans to list Electric three-wheeler business in 2027, Anish Shah says | Exclusive
articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra plans to list its electric three-wheeler business in 2027, aiming to fund growth, as Anish Shah highlights electric mobility and resilience at Davos.

articles.title: Nifty Realty index sees the third-worst start to the year in a decade; Here are the worst performers
articles.summary: Most of India's Real Estate stocks have declined between 7% to 20% so far in 2026, on concerns that the real estate upcycle is facing demand concerns and is on its last legs.

articles.title: HPCL shares downgraded by JPMorgan who warns of excise duty uncertainties
articles.summary: Over the past 12 months, OMC stocks have risen between 23% and 30%, outperforming the Nifty, which is up about 10% over the same period. The rally has largely been driven by strong earnings upgrades.

articles.title: IIFL spots CG Power, Netweb as selective bets amid copper pressure
articles.summary: Renu Baid Pugalia, Senior Vice President of Research at IIFL Institutional Equities, said the wires and cables market has matured enough to pass on cost increases on a weekly or fortnightly basis, a trend visible in the results of Polycab India and Havells India.

articles.title: JPMorgan’s Sanjay Mookim sees fewer earnings cuts, but expects India to lag global markets
articles.summary: JPMorgan’s Sanjay Mookim said earnings downgrades in India have eased for FY26, but growth is likely to trail global markets, especially after currency adjustment. He expects limited support for capex stocks due to fiscal constraints and continues to favour consumer discretionary sectors. Equity supply is also likely to remain high in 2026, which could limit market upside.

articles.title: Zydus Life may acquire US-firm Ardelyx, may raise funds via QIP to part-fund deal: Exclusive
articles.summary: CNBC-TV18 reached out to both, Zydus Life and Ardelyx. While the former said it cannot comment on the speculation, a response from Ardelyx is awaited.

articles.title: PhysicsWallah shares drop 8%, extend losses back towards IPO price
articles.summary: As of 11 am IST, around 44 lakh shares had changed hands. The sharp sell-off has dragged PhysicsWallah's market capitalisation down to ₹32,257 crore, lower than the nearly ₹45,975 crore valuation at the time of its listing.

articles.title: Deepak Nitrite shares gain up to 6% after arm commissions ₹85 crore plant in Dahej, Gujarat
articles.summary: Shares of Deepak Nitrite have snapped a seven-day losing streak in today's trading session. The stock is bucking the trend in an otherwise weak market, gaining on strong volumes as well.

articles.title: Havells India CMD warns of short-term demand impact due to commodity price surge
articles.summary: Havells India's third quarter results were largely in-line with expectations, with the lighting revenue being impacted due to a shift in the festive season this time around.

articles.title: Explained - Key factors behind 11% surge in Bajaj Electricals and impact on peers
articles.summary: Bajaj Electricals plans to foray into wires as a new business line under its Lighting Solutions segment, citing rising demand in the wires industry.

articles.title: TN Governor RN Ravi walks out of assembly, says 'was insulted, wasn't allowed to speak'
articles.summary: The Tamil Nadu Lok Bhavan alleged that the DMK government drafted address that contained “numerous unsubstantiated claims and misleading statements” while ignoring several pressing public concerns. Chief Minister MK Stalin strongly criticised the Governor RN's walkout. Read on:

articles.title: West Bengal SIR: Supreme Court issues directions to Election Commission
articles.summary: To ensure accountability, the Supreme Court directed election officials to certify the receipt of documents and the conduct of hearings. The West Bengal government was instructed to provide adequate manpower to assist the Election Commission during the process.

articles.title: Two women, related to gangster & jailed in murder case, win Pune civic polls
articles.summary: Sonali Vanraj Andekar and Lakshmi Udaykant Andekar are candidates of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) faction led by Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

articles.title: PMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Pune Municipal Corp polls
articles.summary: BJP leading in 90 of 122 declared wards in PMC elections; NCP, Shiv Sena trail behind

articles.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad PCMC Election Results: BJP leads in 83 seats, NCP ahead in 37
articles.summary: The BJP is leading in 83 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad, while Ajit Pawar's NCP is ahead in 37 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad. Meanwhile, the Shiv Sena leads by seven seats.

articles.title: BMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Mumbai
articles.summary: BMC election counting shows BJP-led Mahayuti alliance leading in over 115 wards, Shiv Sena (UBT) trailing, and notable wins for Nishikant Govind Shinde and Khairunisa Akbar Husain.

articles.title: Navi Mumbai civic election results: BJP is leading in 66 seats, Shiv Sena in 42
articles.summary: As per the figures available, the BJP is ahead in 66 seats, while the Shiv Sena (Shinde) is leading in 42 seats. Shiv Sena (UBT) is leading in two seats and MNS in one

articles.title: Pune Municipal Election Results 2026: BJP leading in 90 seats; NCP ahead in 20
articles.summary: The PMC election saw a total of 1,165 candidates contesting for 165 seats. According to the latest data available, the BJP is leading in 80 wards of the civic body.

articles.title: Exit polls predict BJP–Shinde alliance sweep in Mumbai BMC elections after nine years

PhonePe gets Sebi nod for IPO; Microsoft, Walmart to pare stake in OFS

articles.title: Indians face more US visa refusals on social media scrutiny

Even applicants with valid documents are affected, and appointments are being pushed to later in the year. The process now requires additional documents, slowing visa approvals further.

Shadowfax reported a 68% rise in operating revenues to Rs 1,805.

Investments in the ‌sector hit record levels in 2025, with private investment growing 48% to $12.4 billion, including $3.8 billion in the final quarter, according to data from Seraphim Space.

Search, he said, helps users discover new information that "can include commercial interests like new products or services", while "Gemini is your AI assistant" focussed on helping users "create, analyse, and complete" tasks.

articles.title: Micron says ‘unprecedented’ memory shortage to last beyond 2026
articles.summary: High-bandwidth memory required to make artificial intelligence accelerators is “consuming so much of the available capacity across the industry that it’s leaving a tremendous shortage for the conventional side of the industry, for phones or PCs,” Bhatia said. He added that PC and smartphone makers have joined the queue to try to lock up memory chips after 2026.

articles.title: South Korea to negotiate with the US for favourable chip tariff terms, official says
articles.summary: The country ‌last year released a joint fact sheet on its trade deal with the U.S. that ​included terms ensuring ​South Korea will not ‌receive unfavourable ‍treatment from U.S. ‍tariffs on imported chips compared to ‌key competitors, the official said, when asked about the Trump administration's proclamation imposing tariffs on artificial intelligence chips.

articles.title: Micron's $1.8 billion acquisition boosts Powerchip shares
articles.summary: Micron Technology on Saturday ‌said it had signed a letter of intent to ‍acquire Powerchip's P5 ‍fabrication site ⁠in ⁠Tongluo, Miaoli County, Taiwan, for $1.8 billion in cash.

articles.title: Nano GCC attrition shaped by clearly defined roadmaps
articles.summary: India’s nano GCCs are diverging, with long-term centres showing 80-88% employee retention, while short-term or contract-led setups face high churn. Smaller teams of 20-150 employees are highly sensitive to attrition, affecting product delivery and IP development. Rising demand for AI and specialised tech skills is driving targeted hiring and higher salaries.

articles.title: Groww steps up wealth play via MF and portfolio management solutions
articles.summary: Groww is expanding deeper into wealth management by developing platforms for high-net-worth clients and mutual fund distributors. This follows its acquisition of Fisdom, which has been integrated into Groww’s operations. The Bengaluru-based firm aims to scale digital tools to help distributors service clients and compete with startups like AssetPlus and ZFunds.

articles.title: Bill to allow Uber, Lyft in Israel gains committee approval
articles.summary: Israel’s ministerial committee has approved a law to allow ride-hailing services like Uber and Lyft, aiming to reduce taxi fares. The reform, still needing full parliamentary approval, sets safety rules, driver checks, and insurance while supporting existing taxi operators. Transport Minister Miri Regev said it would boost jobs, competition, and ease congestion.

articles.title: Micron to buy Taiwan chip fabrication site for $1.8 billion
articles.summary: Micron Technology plans to buy a Taiwanese fabrication site from Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing for $1.8 billion to boost chip production. The Tongluo site will gradually increase DRAM production, with major volumes expected by 2027, alongside a partnership on assembly processing. The move supports Micron’s global expansion, including investment in new US plants.

articles.title: Social media addiction's surprising challenger? Anti-doomscrolling influencers
articles.summary: Social media users often lose track of time scrolling. Content creators like Olivia Unplugged and Cat Goetze are appearing on platforms to gently remind people about their screen time. They explain the psychology behind social media's addictive nature. Experts agree people spend too much time on apps.

articles.title: In a cooling job market, AI pros still hold the cards
articles.summary: AI professionals are getting not just multiple offers but also counter-offers from existing employers and big incentives. New job offers and counteroffers currently come with 25-70% pay hikes for AI professionals, executives at search firms and recruitment services firms said. This trend is only going to get stronger in 2026, they told ET.

articles.title: Netweb Technologies Q3 profit more than doubles to Rs 73 crore
articles.summary: In an impressive display of growth, Netweb Technologies reported record-breaking quarterly profit and revenue from October to December. The company’s profit after tax soared to Rs 73.31 crore, marking a notable increase year-on-year. Revenue followed suit with a remarkable climb to Rs 811.56 crore.

articles.title: Google files to appeal decision in search monopoly case
articles.summary: Google filed a notice on Friday to appeal a federal judge's ruling that it held an illegal monopoly on online search, court records show. That order risks Google losing trade secrets before a decision is made on its appeal, the company argued in a court filing.

articles.title: Musk jokes about buying Ryanair as Starlink feud with CEO Michael O’Leary escalates
articles.summary: This followed Ryanair’s official account trolling Musk during a widespread outage on X on two consecutive days.
